content.rendered:
Photo via Unsplash

StudioPress planning to include WooCommerce compatibility in all its themes, two new premium Genesis themes released, and get $150 off StudioPress’ all themes package.

Let’s get to it.

—

Themes

Lindsey Riel over at Pretty Dare Cute updates her Pretty theme and it certainly is!

??? NEW Pretty #WordPress theme, now available! #genesiswp https://t.co/QmLZom1pXV #blogginggals pic.twitter.com/zzaJw59Oha

— Lindsey Riel (@lindseyriel) October 17, 2016

Lauren Gaige over at Restored 316 launches a new theme, Cultivate.

Introducing our newest theme, Cultivate! https://t.co/z4pi4l5k0k #genesiswp #wordpress pic.twitter.com/L3ifwzdMSR

— Lauren Gaige (@restored316) October 19, 2016

In last week’s StudioPress.fm podcast with Matt Mullenweg, Brian Gardner revealed that baking WooCommerce compatibility into all future StudioPress themes (and even possibly revisiting current themes) was on the agenda, which Sarah Gooding over at WP Tavern covered this week.

StudioPress Puts WooCommerce Compatibility on the Roadmap for New Themes https://t.co/IxnkLLsUga pic.twitter.com/yseMOHPdj2

— wptavern (@wptavern) October 17, 2016

StudioPress are doing a sale on their Pro Plus (all themes) package, currently $347 (usually $500) expiring 28 October 2016.

Click here for a spectacular, limited-time offer from the company that pioneered the premium WP theme movement. https://t.co/scBAapnQwB

— StudioPress (@studiopress) October 19, 2016

Showcase

Jean-Philippe for lesenfantines.fr

Just launched a #genesiswp site for Les Enfantines, a team dedicated to entertaining your kids with cool activities: https://t.co/rn3IOVHAbO pic.twitter.com/txxWi9Yuww

— Jean-Philippe (@jpmarchand) October 19, 2016

Neil Gee for theroomxchange.com

New site launch – The Room Xchange #genesiswp – https://t.co/UhIwewT3pB pic.twitter.com/PuUaNQjQP2

— Neil Gee (@_neilgee) October 21, 2016

The folks over at Blox (a premium plugin for Genesis) update their website at bloxwp.com

@bloxwp now has shiny new #genesiswp website on a super fast server! If you spot any issues, please let us know! https://t.co/cJIlG6Pgoc

— Blox (@bloxwp) October 17, 2016

Also, Megan Gray updates her showcase and there’s some good stuff on there.

Added a few new projects to my site. Have a nice weekend!
Oh. Tuesday.https://t.co/rPNjm32KJF

— Megan Gray (@HouseofGrays) October 18, 2016

Podcasts

On StudioPress.fm, Brian and Lauren chat to Seth Spears on the one thing that can make or break your creative business.

The One Thing That Can Make or Break Your Creative Business — https://t.co/oxr7vWlchA with @SpearsMarketing pic.twitter.com/shnuNmEqL7

— StudioPress (@studiopress) October 19, 2016

On rethink.fm, Jackie D’Elia chats to Joe Casabona on front end development, having empathy, and stepping into the WP education space.

It’s podcast day! Ep 6 The Heart of a Teacher with Joe Casabona @jcasabona https://t.co/YsXDyJIl0k… #WordPress #eLearning pic.twitter.com/gDYPpAXliT

— Jackie D'Elia (@jdelia) October 19, 2016

Best of the rest

A new (as far as I’m aware) plugin, Genesis Featured Video, from Scott DeLuzio. I haven’t tried it yet but apparently it lets you switch out a featured image for a featured video on a site using a Genesis (h/t Naveen).

https://t.co/w84fSJDIbt Replace featured images in #GenesisWP theme with a featured video from YouTube, Vimeo and other sources. #WordPress

— Naveen-Themesfinity (@NaveenS16) October 17, 2016

Sridhar Katakam reaches the 1,000 post mark on his website.

1000 Posts.

The more I write, the more I realize how less I know.#AlwaysBeLearning pic.twitter.com/pajFEDiFwQ

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) October 16, 2016

He didn’t stop there though, with new posts on how to link post titles with custom URLs in Genesis…

How to link Post Titles with custom URLs on single Posts in Genesis:https://t.co/9xu7IoBO5x#GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/YyQWdka78f

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) October 18, 2016

…and simplifying the code for registering multiple widget areas in Genesis.

Simplifying the code for registering multiple widget areas in Genesis:https://t.co/m2Z3JJsnJF#GenesisWP

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) October 16, 2016

Anita with a new tutorial on setting a featured image for your homepage in Genesis.

How to Set a Featured Image for Your Home Page in Genesis https://t.co/bsukgj90m7 #blogger #fblogger #bbloger #foodie #wordpress

— Anita C. (@TheCre8tiveDiva) October 19, 2016

As well as updating their website (see Showcase above), Blox also published a new explainer video.

What is @bloxwp? How does it work? #GenesisWPhttps://t.co/SM5BigfvXH

— Blox (@bloxwp) October 18, 2016

Kevin Donovan with a couple of short but sweet snippets on allowing shortcodes in the author box for Genesis…

In Case You Missed It – Allow Shortcodes in Author Box for Genesis #wordpress #genesiswp – https://t.co/MpxdiWhH9t via @anythinggraphic pic.twitter.com/DOX9RrsrYB

— Kevin Donnigan (@anythinggraphic) October 17, 2016

…and changing the header logo link in Genesis.

In Case You Missed It – Change Header Logo Link in Genesis #wordpress #genesiswp – https://t.co/9BnqbROItN via @anythinggraphic pic.twitter.com/k5SHPCfkxJ

— Kevin Donnigan (@anythinggraphic) October 21, 2016

Rebecca Gill on why SEO is a process and not a plugin.

SEO is a Process and Not a Plugin https://t.co/hYwDGm2txU

— Rebecca Gill (@rebeccagill) October 20, 2016

More progress on GenesisFactory from Tonya Mork.

Completed loading & parsing a theme's stylesheet. Working on the branding module to let you quickly rebrand a theme. #WordPress #GenesisWP https://t.co/aSHWEktBvL

— Tonya Mork (@hellofromTonya) October 19, 2016

Erika Quagliano is offering a free Genesis theme (when she launches her new site) to those who subscribe beforehand.

It's happening! Dreams do come true. Subscribe now & get a free theme when I launch https://t.co/qJ6CXxhjlw #genesiswp #webdesign #wordpress

— Erika Quagliano (@ErikaQuagliano) October 20, 2016

And finally…

LoopConf 2 (now 2.1) – which was sadly postponed due to Hurricane Matthew – has a new date and a new location, 6–8 February 2017 in Salt Lake City, Utah.

Plans for LoopConf 2.1 are here! Welcome Home ? https://t.co/U9UzzTONN9 Please help spread the word! pic.twitter.com/vRlJ3dlln6

— LoopConf (@loopconf) October 20, 2016

—

That’s all for this week.

Thank you to everyone who shares this update every week, it is hugely appreciated. And if you enjoy these updates – and you’re not already a subscriber – I’d love it if you subscribe below.

Till next time, have a great week.

PS Want to submit your stuff for consideration in a future edition of This Week in Genesis? Just add it via the GenesisWP.guide homepage.

excerpt.rendered: StudioPress to offer WooCommerce compatibility in all themes, two new premium themes released, and get $150 off StudioPress’ all themes package
